org.nsdl.mptstore.util
Class NTriplesUtil

java.lang.Object
  org.nsdl.mptstore.util.NTriplesUtil

public abstract class NTriplesUtil
extends Object

Utility for parsing, validating, and printing strings in N-Triples format.

Author:
cwilper@cs.cornell.edu

Method Detail

consumeURIReference

public static String consumeURIReference(Reader reader,
                                         int pos)
                                  throws IOException,
                                         ParseException
Consume the next URI reference. This will advance the reader through the next '>' character.

Parameters:
reader - the reader to get characters from.
pos - the current position in the overall input.
Returns:
all characters up to an including the terminal, '>'.
Throws:
IOException - if there's an I/O error reading the input.
ParseException - if the reader is exhausted before the terminal is encountered.

consumeWhitespace

public static int consumeWhitespace(Reader reader,
                                    int pos)
                             throws IOException,
                                    ParseException
Move the reader to the first non-whitespace character and return the number of whitespaces encountered.

Parameters:
reader - the reader.
pos - the current position in the reader.
Returns:
the number of whitespaces encountered.
Throws:
IOException - if there is an error reading.
ParseException - if the first character is not a whitespace or EOF is reached before a non-whitespace char.

unescapeLiteralValue

public static String unescapeLiteralValue(String s)
                                   throws ParseException
Unescape an N-Triples-escaped string.
  • All input characters are validated to be 7-bit ASCII.
  • Unicode escapes (\uxxxx and \Uxxxxxxxx) are validated to be complete and legal, and are restored to the value indicated by the hexadecimal argument.
  • Backslash-escaped values (\t, \r, \n, \", and \\) are restored to their original form (tab, carriage return, linefeed, quote, and backslash, respectively).

Parameters:
s - The input string.
Returns:
The unescaped string.
Throws:
ParseException - if the input syntax is incorrect

escapeLiteralValue

public static String escapeLiteralValue(String s)
Escape a string to N-Triples literal format.
  • Unicode escaping (\uxxxx or \Uxxxxxxxx, a appropriate) will be used for all characters in the following ranges:
    • 0x0 through 0x8
    • 0xB through 0xC
    • 0xE through 0x1F
    • 0x7F through 0xFFFF
    • 0x10000 through 0x10FFFF
  • Backslash escaping will be used for double quote (\"), backslash (\\), line feed (\n), carriage return (\r), and tab (\t) characters.
  • All other characters will be represented as-is.

Parameters:
s - The input string.
Returns:
The escaped string.

validateLanguage

public static void validateLanguage(String language)
                             throws ParseException
Validate the given language tag according to RFC3066. The grammar for a language tag is: 
   LANGUAGE-TAG   = PRIMARY-SUBTAG ("-" SUBTAG)*
   PRIMARY-SUBTAG = 1-8(ALPHA)
   SUBTAG         = 1-8(ALPHA/DIGIT)

Parameters:
language - the language to validate.
Throws:
ParseException - if the language is syntactically invalid.
